pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 07)

Raag Gauree − Part 001 151 : 1 Raag Gauree Gwaarayree, First Mehl, Chau−Padas &Du−Padas: 151 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 151 : 3 The Fear of God is overpowering, and so very heavy, 151 : 4 while the intellect is lightweight, as is the speech one speaks. 151 : 5 So place the Fear of God upon your head, and bear that weight; 151 : 6 by the Grace of the Merciful Lord, contemplate the Guru. ||1|| 151 : 7 Without the Fear of God, no one crosses over the world−ocean. 151 : 8 This Fear of God adorns the Love of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 151 : 9 The fire of fear within the body is burnt away by the Fear of God. 2

151 : 10 Through this Fear of God, we are adorned with the Word of the Shabad. 151 : 11 Without the Fear of God, all that is fashioned is false. 151 : 12 Useless is the mold, and useless are the hammer−strokes on the mold. ||2|| 151 : 13 The desire for the worldly drama arises in the intellect, 151 : 14 but even with thousands of clever mental tricks, the heat of the Fear of God does not come into play. 151 : 15 O Nanak, the speech of the self−willed manmukh is just wind. 151 : 16 His words are worthless and empty, like the wind. ||3||1|| 151 : 17 Gauree, First Mehl: 151 : 18 Place the Fear of God within the home of your heart; with this Fear of God in your heart, all other fears shall be frightened away. 151 : 19 Raag Gauree − Part 001 3

What sort of fear is that, which frightens other fears? 151 : 20 Without You, I have other place of rest at all. 151 : 21 Whatever happens is all according to Your Will. ||1|| 151 : 22 Be afraid, if you have any fear, other than the Fear of God. 151 : 23 Afraid of fear, and living in fear, the mind is held in tumult. ||1||Pause|| 151 : 24 The soul does not die; it does not drown, and it does not swim across. 151 : 25 The One who created everything does everything. 151 : 26 By the Hukam of His Command we come, and by the Hukam of His Command we go. 151 : 27 Before and after, His Command is pervading. ||2|| 151 : 28 Cruelty, attachment, desire and egotism 151 : 29 Raag Gauree − Part 001 4

− there is great hunger in these, like the raging torrent of a wild stream. 151 : 30 Let the Fear of God be your food, drink and support. 151 : 31 Without doing this, the fools simply die. ||3|| 151 : 32 If anyone really has anyone else − how rare is that person! 151 : 33 All are Yours − You are the Lord of all. 151 : 34 All beings and creatures, wealth and property belong to Him. 151 : 35 O Nanak, it is so difficult to describe and contemplate Him. ||4||2|| 151 : 36 Gauree, First Mehl: 151 : 37 Let wisdom be your mother, and contentment your father. 151 : 38 Let Truth be your brother − these are your best relatives. ||1|| 151 : 39 Raag Gauree − Part 001 5
He has been described, but He cannot be described at all. 151 : 40 Your All−pervading creative nature cannot be estimated. ||1||Pause|| −− Raag Gauree − Part 001 −− Raag Gauree − Part 001 6

Raag Gauree − Part 002 152 : 41 Modesty, humility and intuitive understanding are my mother−in−law and father−in−law; 152 : 42 I have made good deeds my spouse. ||2|| 152 : 43 Union with the Holy is my wedding date, and separation from the world is my marriage. 152 : 44 Says Nanak, Truth is the child born of this Union. ||3||3|| 152 : 45 Gauree, First Mehl: 152 : 46 The union of air, water and fire 152 : 47 − the body is the play−thing of the fickle and unsteady intellect. 152 : 48 It has nine doors, and then there is the Tenth Gate. 152 : 49 Reflect upon this and understand it, O wise one. ||1|| 7

152 : 50 The Lord is the One who speaks, teaches and listens. 152 : 51 One who contemplates his own self is truly wise. ||1||Pause|| 152 : 52 The body is dust; the wind speaks through it. 152 : 53 Understand, O wise one, who has died. 152 : 54 Awareness, conflict and ego have died, 152 : 55 but the One who sees does not die. ||2|| 152 : 56 For the sake of it, you journey to sacred shrines and holy rivers; 152 : 57 but this priceless jewel is within your own heart. 152 : 58 The Pandits, the religious scholars, read and read endlessly; they stir up arguments and controversies, 152 : 59 but they do not know the secret deep within. ||3|| Raag Gauree − Part 002 8

152 : 60 I have not died − that evil nature within me has died. 152 : 61 The One who is pervading everywhere does not die. 152 : 62 Says Nanak, the Guru has revealed God to me, 152 : 63 and now I see that there is no such thing as birth or death. ||4||4|| 152 : 64 Gauree, First Mehl, Dakhanee: 152 : 65 I am forever a sacrifice to the one who listens and hears, who understands and believes in the Name. 152 : 66 When the Lord Himself leads us astray, there is no other place of rest for us to find. 152 : 67 You impart understanding, and You unite us in Your Union. ||1|| 152 : 68 I obtain the Naam, which shall go along with me in the end. 152 : 69 Without the Name, all are held in the grip of Death. ||1||Pause|| Raag Gauree − Part 002 9

152 : 70 My farming and my trading are by the Support of the Name. 152 : 71 The seeds of sin and virtue are bound together. 152 : 72 Sexual desire and anger are the wounds of the soul. 152 : 73 The evil−minded ones forget the Naam, and then depart. ||2|| 152 : 74 True are the Teachings of the True Guru. 152 : 75 The body and mind are cooled and soothed, by the touchstone of Truth. 152 : 76 This is the true mark of wisdom: that one remains detached, like the water−lily, or the lotus upon the water. 152 : 77 Attuned to the Word of the Shabad, one becomes sweet, like the juice of the sugar cane. ||3|| 152 : 78 By the Hukam of the Lord's Command, the castle of the body has ten gates. 152 : 79 Raag Gauree − Part 002 10

The five passions dwell there, together with the Divine Light of the Infinite. 152 : 80 The Lord Himself is the merchandise, and He Himself is the trader. 152 : 81 O Nanak, through the Naam, the Name of the Lord, we are adorned and rejuvenated. ||4||5|| 152 : 82 Gauree, First Mehl: 152 : 83 How can we know where we came from? 152 : 84 Where did we originate, and where will we go and merge? 152 : 85 How are we bound, and how do we obtain liberation? 152 : 86 How do we merge with intuitive ease into the Eternal, Imperishable Lord? ||1|| 152 : 87 With the Naam in the heart and the Ambrosial Naam on our lips, 152 : 88 through the Name of the Lord, we rise above desire, like the Lord. ||1||Pause|| Raag Gauree − Part 002 11

152 : 89 With intuitive ease we come, and with intuitive ease we depart. 152 : 90 From the mind we originate, and into the mind we are absorbed. 152 : 91 As Gurmukh, we are liberated, and are not bound. 152 : 92 Contemplating the Word of the Shabad, we are emancipated through the Name of the Lord. ||2|| 152 : 93 At night, lots of birds settle on the tree. 152 : 94 Some are happy, and some are sad. Caught in the desires of the mind, they perish. 152 : 95 And when the life−night comes to its end, then they look to the sky. 152 : 96 They fly away in all ten directions, according to their pre−ordained destiny. ||3|| −− Raag Gauree − Part 002 −− Raag Gauree − Part 002 12

Raag Gauree − Part 003 153 : 97 Those who are committed to the Naam, see the world as merely a temporary pasture. 153 : 98 Sexual desire and anger are broken, like a jar of poison. 153 : 99 Without the merchandise of the Name, the house of the body and the store of the mind are empty. 153 : 100 Meeting the Guru, the hard and heavy doors are opened. ||4|| 153 : 101 One meets the Holy Saint only through perfect destiny. 153 : 102 The Lord's perfect people rejoice in the Truth. 153 : 103 Surrendering their minds and bodies, they find the Lord with intuitive ease. 153 : 104 Nanak falls at their feet. ||5||6|| 153 : 105 Gauree, First Mehl: 13

153 : 106 The conscious mind is engrossed in sexual desire, anger and Maya. 153 : 107 The conscious mind is awake only to falsehood, corruption and attachment. 153 : 108 It gathers in the assets of sin and greed. 153 : 109 So swim across the river of life, O my mind, with the Sacred Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 153 : 110 Waaho! Waaho! − Great! Great is my True Lord! I seek Your All−powerful Support. 153 : 111 I am a sinner − You alone are pure. ||1||Pause|| 153 : 112 Fire and water join together, and the breath roars in its fury! 153 : 113 The tongue and the sex organs each seek to taste. 153 : 114 The eyes which look upon corruption do not know the Love and the Fear of God. 153 : 115 Conquering self−conceit, one obtains the Name. ||2|| Raag Gauree − Part 003 14

153 : 116 One who dies in the Word of the Shabad, shall never again have to die. 153 : 117 Without such a death, how can one attain perfection? 153 : 118 The mind is engrossed in deception, treachery and duality. 153 : 119 Whatever the Immortal Lord does, comes to pass. ||3|| 153 : 120 So get aboard that boat when your turn comes. 153 : 121 Those who fail to embark upon that boat shall be beaten in the Court of the Lord. 153 : 122 Blessed is that Gurdwara, the Guru's Gate, where the Praises of the True Lord are sung. 153 : 123 O Nanak, the One Creator Lord is pervading hearth and home. ||4||7|| 153 : 124 Gauree, First Mehl: 153 : 125 The inverted heart−lotus has been turned upright, through reflective meditation on God. Raag Gauree − Part 003 15

153 : 126 From the Sky of the Tenth Gate, the Ambrosial Nectar trickles down. 153 : 127 The Lord Himself is pervading the three worlds. ||1|| 153 : 128 O my mind, do not give in to doubt. 153 : 129 When the mind surrenders to the Name, it drinks in the essence of Ambrosial Nectar. ||1||Pause|| 153 : 130 So win the game of life; let your mind surrender and accept death. 153 : 131 When the self dies, the individual mind comes to know the Supreme Mind. 153 : 132 As the inner vision is awakened, one comes to know one's own home, deep within the self. ||2|| 153 : 133 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is austerity, chastity and cleansing baths at sacred shrines of pilgrimage. 153 : 134 What good are ostentatious displays? 153 : 135 Raag Gauree − Part 003 16

The All−pervading Lord is the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts. ||3|| 153 : 136 If I had faith in someone else, then I would go to that one's house. 153 : 137 But where should I go, to beg? There is no other place for me. 153 : 138 O Nanak, through the Guru's Teachings, I am intuitively absorbed in the Lord. ||4||8|| 153 : 139 Gauree, First Mehl: 153 : 140 Meeting the True Guru, we are shown the way to die. 153 : 141 Remaining alive in this death brings joy deep within. 153 : 142 Overcoming egotistical pride, the Tenth Gate is found. ||1|| 153 : 143 Death is pre−ordained − no one who comes can remain here. 153 : 144 So chant and meditate on the Lord, and remain in the Sanctuary of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 153 : 145 Raag Gauree − Part 003 17

Meeting the True Guru, duality is dispelled. 153 : 146 The heart−lotus blossoms forth, and the mind is attached to the Lord God. 153 : 147 One who remains dead while yet alive obtains the greatest happiness hereafter. ||2|| 153 : 148 Meeting the True Guru, one becomes truthful, chaste and pure. 153 : 149 Climbing up the steps of the Guru's Path, one becomes the highest of the high. 153 : 150 When the Lord grants His Mercy, the fear of death is conquered. ||3|| 153 : 151 Uniting in Guru's Union, we are absorbed in His Loving Embrace. 153 : 152 Granting His Grace, He reveals the Mansion of His Presence, within the home of the self. 153 : 153 O Nanak, conquering egotism, we are absorbed into the Lord. ||4||9|| −− Raag Gauree − Part 003 −− Raag Gauree − Part 003 18

Raag Gauree − Part 004 154 : 154 Gauree, First Mehl: 154 : 155 Past actions cannot be erased. 154 : 156 What do we know of what will happen hereafter? 154 : 157 Whatever pleases Him shall come to pass. 154 : 158 There is no other Doer except Him. ||1|| 154 : 159 I do not know about karma, or how great Your gifts are. 154 : 160 The karma of actions, the Dharma of righteousness, social class and status, are contained within Your Name. ||1||Pause|| 154 : 161 You are So Great, O Giver, O Great Giver! 154 : 162 The treasure of Your devotional worship is never exhausted. 19

154 : 163 One who takes pride in himself shall never be right. 154 : 164 The soul and body are all at Your disposal. ||2|| 154 : 165 You kill and rejuvenate. You forgive and merge us into Yourself. 154 : 166 As it pleases You, You inspire us to chant Your Name. 154 : 167 You are All−knowing, All−seeing and True, O my Supreme Lord. 154 : 168 Please, bless me with the Guru's Teachings; my faith is in You alone. ||3|| 154 : 169 One whose mind is attuned to the Lord, has no pollution in his body. 154 : 170 Through the Guru's Word, the True Shabad is realized. 154 : 171 All Power is Yours, through the greatness of Your Name. 154 : 172 Nanak abides in the Sanctuary of Your devotees. ||4||10|| Raag Gauree − Part 004 20

154 : 173 Gauree, First Mehl: 154 : 174 Those who speak the Unspoken, drink in the Nectar. 154 : 175 Other fears are forgotten, and they are absorbed into the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 154 : 176 Why should we fear, when fear is dispelled by the Fear of God? 154 : 177 Through the Shabad, the Word of the Perfect Guru, I recognize God. ||1||Pause|| 154 : 178 Those whose hearts are filled with the Lord's essence are blessed and acclaimed, and intuitively absorbed into the Lord. ||2|| 154 : 179 Those whom the Lord puts to sleep, evening and morning 154 : 180 − those self−willed manmukhs are bound and gagged by Death, here and hereafter. ||3|| 154 : 181 Those whose hearts are filled with the Lord, day and night, are perfect. 154 : 182 O Nanak, they merge into the Lord, and their doubts are cast away. ||4||11|| Raag Gauree − Part 004 21

154 : 183 Gauree, First Mehl: 154 : 184 One who loves the three qualities is subject to birth and death. 154 : 185 The four Vedas speak only of the visible forms. 154 : 186 They describe and explain the three states of mind, 154 : 187 but the fourth state, union with the Lord, is known only through the True Guru. ||1|| 154 : 188 Through devotional worship of the Lord, and service to the Guru, one swims across. 154 : 189 Then, one is not born again, and is not subject to death. ||1||Pause|| 154 : 190 Everyone speaks of the four great blessings; 154 : 191 the Simritees, the Shaastras and the Pandits speak of them as well. 154 : 192 But without the Guru, they do not understand their true significance. Raag Gauree − Part 004 22

154 : 193 The treasure of liberation is obtained through devotional worship of the Lord. ||2|| 154 : 194 Those, within whose hearts the Lord dwells, 154 : 195 become Gurmukh; they receive the blessings of devotional worship. 154 : 196 Through devotional worship of the Lord, liberation and bliss are obtained. 154 : 197 Through the Guru's Teachings, supreme ecstasy is obtained. ||3|| 154 : 198 One who meets the Guru, beholds Him, and inspires others to behold Him as well. 154 : 199 In the midst of hope, the Guru teaches us to live above hope and desire. 154 : 200 He is the Master of the meek, the Giver of peace to all. 154 : 201 Nanak's mind is imbued with the Lotus Feet of the Lord. ||4||12|| 154 : 202 Gauree Chaytee, First Mehl: Raag Gauree − Part 004 23

154 : 203 With your nectar−like body, you live in comfort, but this world is just a passing drama. 154 : 204 You practice greed, avarice and great falsehood, and you carry such a heavy burden. 154 : 205 O body, I have seen you blowing away like dust on the earth. ||1|| 154 : 206 Listen − listen to my advice! 154 : 207 Only the good deeds which you have done shall remain with you, O my soul. This opportunity shall not come again! ||1||Pause|| −− Raag Gauree − Part 004 −− Raag Gauree − Part 004 24

Raag Gauree − Part 005 155 : 208 I say to you, O my body: listen to my advice! 155 : 209 You slander, and then praise others; you indulge in lies and gossip. 155 : 210 You gaze upon the wives of others, O my soul; you steal and commit evil deeds. 155 : 211 But when the swan departs, you shall remain behind, like an abandoned woman. ||2|| 155 : 212 O body, you are living in a dream! What good deeds have you done? 155 : 213 When I stole something by deception, then my mind was pleased. 155 : 214 I have no honor in this world, and I shall find no shelter in the world hereafter. My life has been lost, wasted in vain! ||3|| 155 : 215 I am totally miserable! O Baba Nanak, no one cares for me at all! ||1||Pause|| 155 : 216 Turkish horses, gold, silver and loads of gorgeous clothes 25

155 : 217 − none of these shall go with you, O Nanak. They are lost and left behind, you fool! 155 : 218 I have tasted all the sugar candy and sweets, but Your Name alone is Ambrosial Nectar. ||4|| 155 : 219 Digging deep foundations, the walls are constructed, but in the end, the buildings return to heaps of dust. 155 : 220 People gather and hoard their possessions, and give nothing to anyone else − the poor fools think that everything is theirs. 155 : 221 Riches do not remain with anyone − not even the golden palaces of Sri Lanka. ||5|| 155 : 222 Listen, you foolish and ignorant mind 155 : 223 − only His Will prevails. ||1||Pause|| 155 : 224 My Banker is the Great Lord and Master. I am only His petty merchant. 155 : 225 This soul and body all are His. He Himself kills, and brings back to life. ||6||1||13|| 155 : 226 Raag Gauree − Part 005 26

Gauree Chaytee, First Mehl: 155 : 227 There are five of them, but I am all alone. How can I protect my hearth and home, O my mind? 155 : 228 They are beating and plundering me over and over again; unto whom can I complain? ||1|| 155 : 229 Chant the Name of the Supreme Lord, O my mind. 155 : 230 Otherwise, in the world hereafter, you will have to face the awesome and cruel army of Death. ||1||Pause|| 155 : 231 God has erected the temple of the body; He has placed the nine doors, and the soul−bride sits within. 155 : 232 She enjoys the sweet play again and again, while the five demons are plundering her. ||2|| 155 : 233 In this way, the temple is being demolished; the body is being plundered, and the soul−bride, left all alone, is captured. 155 : 234 Death strikes her down with his rod, the shackles are placed around her neck, and now the five have left. ||3|| 155 : 235 Raag Gauree − Part 005 27

The wife yearns for gold and silver, and her friends, the senses, yearn for good food. 155 : 236 O Nanak, she commits sins for their sake; she shall go, bound and gagged, to the City of Death. ||4||2||14|| 155 : 237 Gauree Chaytee, First Mehl: 155 : 238 Let your ear−rings be those ear−rings which pierce deep within your heart. Let your body be your patched coat. 155 : 239 Let the five passions be disciples under your control, O begging Yogi, and make this mind your walking stick. ||1|| 155 : 240 Thus you shall find the Way of Yoga. 155 : 241 There is only the One Word of the Shabad; everything else shall pass away. Let this be the fruits and roots of your mind's diet. ||1||Pause|| 155 : 242 Some try to find the Guru by shaving their heads at the Ganges, but I have made the Guru my Ganges. 155 : 243 The Saving Grace of the three worlds is the One Lord and Master, but those in darkness do not remember Him. ||2|| Raag Gauree − Part 005 28
155 : 244 Practicing hypocrisy and attaching your mind to worldly objects, your doubt shall never depart. −− Raag Gauree − Part 005 −− Raag Gauree − Part 005 29

Raag Gauree − Part 006 156 : 245 If you focus your consciousness on the Feet of the One Lord, what reason would you have to chase after greed? ||3|| 156 : 246 Meditate on the Immaculate Lord, and saturate your mind with Him. 156 : 247 Why, O Yogi, do you make so many false and deceptive claims? ||1||Pause|| 156 : 248 The body is wild, and the mind is foolish. Practicing egotism, selfishness and conceit, your life is passing away. 156 : 249 Prays Nanak, when the naked body is cremated, then you will come to regret and repent. ||4||3||15|| 156 : 250 Gauree Chaytee, First Mehl: 156 : 251 O mind, there is only the One medicine, mantra and healing herb − center your consciousness firmly on the One Lord. 156 : 252 Take to the Lord, the Destroyer of the sins and karma of past incarnations. ||1|| 156 : 253 30

The One Lord and Master is pleasing to my mind. 156 : 254 In Your three qualities, the world is engrossed; the Unknowable cannot be known. ||1||Pause|| 156 : 255 Maya is so sweet to the body, like sugar or molasses. We all carry loads of it. 156 : 256 In the dark of the night, nothing can be seen. The mouse of death is gnawing away at the rope of life, O Siblings of Destiny! ||2|| 156 : 257 As the self−willed manmukhs act, they suffer in pain. The Gurmukh obtains honor and greatness. 156 : 258 Whatever He does, that alone happens; past actions cannot be erased. ||3|| 156 : 259 Those who are imbued with, and committed to the Lord's Love, are filled to overflowing; they never lack anything. 156 : 260 If Nanak could be the dust of their feet, then he, the ignorant one, might also obtain some. ||4||4||16|| 156 : 261 Gauree Chaytee, First Mehl: 156 : 262 Raag Gauree − Part 006 31

Who is our mother, and who is our father? Where did we come from? 156 : 263 We are formed from the fire of the womb within, and the bubble of water of the sperm. For what purpose are we created? ||1|| 156 : 264 O my Master, who can know Your Glorious Virtues? 156 : 265 My own demerits cannot be counted. ||1||Pause|| 156 : 266 I took the form of so many plants and trees, and so many animals. 156 : 267 Many times I entered the families of snakes and flying birds. ||2|| 156 : 268 I broke into the shops of the city and well−guarded palaces; stealing from them, I snuck home again. 156 : 269 I looked in front of me, and I looked behind me, but where could I hide from You? ||3|| 156 : 270 I saw the banks of sacred rivers, the nine continents, the shops and bazaars of the cities. 156 : 271 Taking the scale, the merchant begins to weigh his actions within his own heart. ||4|| Raag Gauree − Part 006 32

156 : 272 As the seas and the oceans are overflowing with water, so vast are my own sins. 156 : 273 Please, shower me with Your Mercy, and take pity upon me. I am a sinking stone − please carry me across! ||5|| 156 : 274 My soul is burning like fire, and the knife is cutting deep. 156 : 275 Prays Nanak, recognizing the Lord's Command, I am at peace, day and night. ||6||5||17|| 156 : 276 Gauree Bairaagan, First Mehl: 156 : 277 The nights are wasted sleeping, and the days are wasted eating. 156 : 278 Human life is such a precious jewel, but it is being lost in exchange for a mere shell. ||1|| 156 : 279 You do not know the Name of the Lord. 156 : 280 You fool − you shall regret and repent in the end! ||1||Pause|| 156 : 281 You bury your temporary wealth in the ground, but how can you love that which is Raag Gauree − Part 006 33

temporary? 156 : 282 Those who have departed, after craving for temporary wealth, have returned home without this temporary wealth. ||2|| 156 : 283 If people could gather it in by their own efforts, then everyone would be so lucky. −− Raag Gauree − Part 006 −− Raag Gauree − Part 006 34

Raag Gauree − Part 007 157 : 284 According to the karma of past actions, one's destiny unfolds, even though everyone wants to be so lucky. ||3|| 157 : 285 O Nanak, the One who created the creation − He alone takes care of it. 157 : 286 The Hukam of our Lord and Master's Command cannot be known; He Himself blesses us with greatness. ||4||1||18|| 157 : 287 Gauree Bairaagan, First Mehl: 157 : 288 What if I were to become a deer, and live in the forest, picking and eating fruits and roots 157 : 289 − by Guru's Grace, I am a sacrifice to my Master. Again and again, I am a sacrifice, a sacrifice. ||1|| 157 : 290 I am the shop−keeper of the Lord. 157 : 291 Your Name is my merchandise and trade. ||1||Pause|| 157 : 292 35

If I were to become a cuckoo, living in a mango tree, I would still contemplate the Word of the Shabad. 157 : 293 I would still meet my Lord and Master, with intuitive ease; the Darshan, the Blessed Vision of His Form, is incomparably beautiful. ||2|| 157 : 294 If I were to become a fish, living in the water, I would still remember the Lord, who watches over all beings and creatures. 157 : 295 My Husband Lord dwells on this shore, and on the shore beyond; I would still meet Him, and hug Him close in my embrace. ||3|| 157 : 296 If I were to become a snake, living in the ground, the Shabad would still dwell in my mind, and my fears would be dispelled. 157 : 297 O Nanak, they are forever the happy soul−brides, whose light merges into His Light. ||4||2||19|| 157 : 298 Gauree Poorbee Deepkee, First Mehl: 157 : 299 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 157 : 300 In that house where the Praises of the Creator are chanted Raag Gauree − Part 007 36

157 : 301 − in that house, sing the Songs of Praise, and meditate in remembrance on the Creator Lord. ||1|| 157 : 302 Sing the Songs of Praise of my Fearless Lord. 157 : 303 I am a sacrifice to that Song of Praise which brings eternal peace. ||1||Pause|| 157 : 304 Day after day, He cares for His beings; the Great Giver watches over all. 157 : 305 Your gifts cannot be appraised; how can anyone compare to the Giver? ||2|| 157 : 306 The day of my wedding is pre−ordained. Come − let's gather together and pour the oil over the threshold. 157 : 307 My friends, give me your blessings, that I may merge with my Lord and Master. ||3|| 157 : 308 Unto each and every home, into each and every heart, this summons is sent out; the call comes each and every day. 157 : 309 Remember in meditation the One who summons us; O Nanak, that day is drawing near! ||4||1||20|| Raag Gauree − Part 007 37

157 : 310 Raag Gauree Gwaarayree: 157 : 311 Third Mehl, Chau−Padas: 157 : 312 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 157 : 313 Meeting the Guru, we meet the Lord. 157 : 314 He Himself unites us in His Union. 157 : 315 My God knows all His Own Ways. 157 : 316 By the Hukam of His Command, He unites those who recognize the Word of the Shabad. ||1|| 157 : 317 By the Fear of the True Guru, doubt and fear are dispelled. 157 : 318 Imbued with His Fear, we are absorbed in the Love of the True One. ||1||Pause|| 157 : 319 Meeting the Guru, the Lord naturally dwells within the mind. Raag Gauree − Part 007 38

157 : 320 My God is Great and Almighty; His value cannot be estimated. 157 : 321 Through the Shabad, I praise Him; He has no end or limitations. 157 : 322 My God is the Forgiver. I pray that He may forgive me. ||2|| 157 : 323 Meeting the Guru, all wisdom and understanding are obtained. −− Raag Gauree − Part 007 −− Raag Gauree − Part 007 39

Raag Gauree − Part 008 158 : 324 The mind becomes pure, when the True Lord dwells within. 158 : 325 When one dwells in Truth, all actions become true. 158 : 326 The ultimate action is to contemplate the Word of the Shabad. ||3|| 158 : 327 Through the Guru, true service is performed. 158 : 328 How rare is that Gurmukh who recognizes the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 158 : 329 The Giver, the Great Giver, lives forever. 158 : 330 Nanak enshrines love for the Name of the Lord. ||4||1||21|| 158 : 331 Gauree Gwaarayree, Third Mehl: 158 : 332 Those who obtain spiritual wisdom from the Guru are very rare. 40

158 : 333 Those who obtain this understanding from the Guru become acceptable. 158 : 334 Through the Guru, we intuitively contemplate the True One. 158 : 335 Through the Guru, the Gate of Liberation is found. ||1|| 158 : 336 Through perfect good destiny, we come to meet the Guru. 158 : 337 The true ones are intuitively absorbed in the True Lord. ||1||Pause|| 158 : 338 Meeting the Guru, the fire of desire is quenched. 158 : 339 Through the Guru, peace and tranquility come to dwell within the mind. 158 : 340 Through the Guru, we become pure, holy and true. 158 : 341 Through the Guru, we are absorbed in the Word of the Shabad. ||2|| 158 : 342 Without the Guru, everyone wanders in doubt. Raag Gauree − Part 008 41

158 : 343 Without the Name, they suffer in terrible pain. 158 : 344 Those who meditate on the Naam become Gurmukh. 158 : 345 True honor is obtained through the Darshan, the Blessed Vision of the True Lord. ||3|| 158 : 346 Why speak of any other? He alone is the Giver. 158 : 347 When He grants His Grace, union with the Shabad is obtained. 158 : 348 Meeting with my Beloved, I sing the Glorious Praises of the True Lord. 158 : 349 O Nanak, becoming true, I am absorbed in the True One. ||4||2||22|| 158 : 350 Gauree Gwaarayree, Third Mehl: 158 : 351 True is that place, where the mind becomes pure. 158 : 352 True is the one who abides in Truth. Raag Gauree − Part 008 42

158 : 353 The True Bani of the Word is known throughout the four ages. 158 : 354 The True One Himself is everything. ||1|| 158 : 355 Through the karma of good actions, one joins the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation. 158 : 356 Sing the Glories of the Lord, sitting in that place. ||1||Pause|| 158 : 357 Burn this tongue, which loves duality, 158 : 358 which does not taste the sublime essence of the Lord, and which utters insipid words. 158 : 359 Without understanding, the body and mind become tasteless and insipid. 158 : 360 Without the Name, the miserable ones depart crying out in pain. ||2|| 158 : 361 One whose tongue naturally and intuitively tastes the Lord's sublime essence, by Guru's Grace, is absorbed in the True Lord. 158 : 362 Imbued with Truth, one contemplates the Word of the Guru's Shabad, Raag Gauree − Part 008 43
